pros:
This is the big-leagues when it comes to research. Great, colloborative atmosphere in the Cancer Center. Amazing opportunities to do world-class research with some of the smartest people on the planet. 

Perfect "stepping-stone" job for someone right after college.
cons: Some labs can have really long hours.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Boston, MA
pros: I love that Mass Gen has great benefits and excellent benefits with unparalleled learning opportunities. I guess it depends on your boss. Mine is great.
cons: The job is relatively low paid. That’s really my only complaint in this otherwise excellent place to work.

job_title: Patient Services Coordinator in Boston, MA
pros: Great benefits, rewarding job, good team support
cons: Growth within organization seems to take a long time.  Sometimes not flexible with taking time off, which effects  having a good work/life balance

job_title: Clinical Research Associate in Boston, MA
pros: Once you're an employee they look after you for the most part. In terms of medical problems.
cons: Pay was not that good

review_title: Great Hospital, great place to work
pros: Great people, very interesting work, excellent procedures and workflow, right off the T
cons: Long hours, parking $, legacy communication systems, long acclimation time

review_title: Mediocre in work, excellent in brand name and network
pros: Worked and networked with some of the greatest minds in scientific research from all over the world
cons: Highly competitive, better come with a niche skill-set that is in demand

review_title: Good place to work but salaries not great
pros: Decent benefits, good atmosphere, cutting edge science and healthcare
cons: Salaries are low, partners a giant bureaucracy, attitude is you should be grateful to work there

pros: They have good health care benefits including employee services. Cafeteria offers many menu choices. Salaries are competitive with other medical facilities.
cons: Large facility with overwhelming amount of departments. Some Managers tend to be micro managers. Human resources dept could be more supportive to staff upon departure.

pros: Flexible schedule, great management, room to grow and fantastic training opportunities.
cons: Pay is below average, healthcare is expensive (but thorough) and their tuition reimbursement program is essentially non-existent.

pros: My coworkers were genuinely wonderful
cons: Terrible, vile, anti-union organization that tries to convince people they can eat prestige and don’t need their own voice because they just match what the Brigham nurses negotiate for themselves with their voice. You think you’re going to put in your time and get a good unit until you realize it’s cheaper for them to hire new grads than it is to respect the people that have put their time in.

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Boston, MA
pros: A very organized place where you have access to all kinds of resources (statistician, courses, training, etc). It seems that they really invest in the employee, and give you many opportunities to grow in your career
cons: Too much bureaucracy, strict rules, and policies.

pros: Good collaboration between basic and clinical research. Great childcare centers.
cons: Instructor salary cap has not changed for the past 10 years regardless of inflation rate. The salary offered is lower than other medical centers which makes it harder to recruit/retain research assistant.

pros: Working at a top 5 U.S. hospital allows for opportunities to work in cutting edge research with industry leaders. Working downtown and work/life benefits are also huge pros.
cons: Salary is extremely low, mostly as a result of low funding and budget allowances.

pros: Good mix of freedom and structure. Large company with benefits of scale, but many levels of organization so that one can find ones most comfortable size of community.
cons: Great benefits, but salary for research staff is low compared to industry (especially in Boston)

pros: Good benefits, Doctors are passionate about patient care and truly are the absolute best in patient care
cons: No work/life balance, work can start to make you feel like a robot/factory line, coworkers can be unprofessional and don't belong in hospital setting/customer service

review_title: Great benefits but poor workplace environment for scientists
pros: Great health care benefits. Access to resources.
cons: Poor work environment. Poor support by the admin staff for Visa issues and grant submission

pros: it is a very flexible work environment which contribute to a good work/life balance. The projects/work are challenging and initiative is encouraged.
cons: The most discouraging aspect is the political game that needs to be played to achieved deadlines. Low prospects of growing opportunities.

review_title: Great Company /  Family to be a part of
job_title: Senior Research Technician in Boston, MA
pros: Its a family of people working together to help heal the sick
cons: I really dont have anything bad to say or complain about. I love working at this hospital.

pros: Great people. Great benefits. Interesting stuff going on all the time. I am always challenged.
cons: People here can be very stuck up and self-absorbed. Academic environments breed these kinds of people though. But they are the best at what they do. No doubt.

job_title: Patient Care Associate in Boston, MA
pros: make impact, have a stable job, work part of a team, access to healthcare benefits, receive a good salary, clean environment.
cons: exposure to germs, no parking available during morning and afternoon weekday shifts, have to work with different patients each day.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator II in Boston, MA
pros: You are working with some of the smartest minds in the world, excellent exposure, MGH really values their employees. Overall MGH has a great culture, I am glad to be part of it!
cons: Low salaries, expected working in a clinical/academic setting

pros: training was very professional, vacation time was lovely
cons: horrible pay, does not promote often enough

pros: First class health care, great benefits, great teamwork, competitive salary.
cons: middle managers not  as knowledgeable as staff.

review_title: Good starter position, not much room for growth
job_title: Senior Regulatory Affairs Coordinator in Boston, MA
pros: great benefits, time off, good for starting career or for advanced professionals, receptive to feedback, interest in streamlining processes
cons: high managerial turnover, employee turnover, could be more attention to individual employee's career goals, some inconsistent standards

pros: Great benefits and some amazing physicians - very kind and caring. If you work with the right group you can really do well.
cons: Salary tends to be below market even for comparable non profit. Look out for power-driven administrators especially in oncology research.

job_title: Senior Research Technologist in Boston, MA
pros: Good colleagues and teams. The people are help and great if you want to learn and acquire skills so you can move someplace else
cons: Little chance to advancement with Phd in academic research

pros: great insurance package, employee perks provide discounts to some local events and businesses
cons: low pay, technology is slow to be introduced, not many employee perks in office

pros: Benefits are good that's about it.
cons: The pay is definitely not good. The only ones who benefit are the upper management or executives. Every year they are doing cuts in different departments. The pay is based on years of experience you have within the department, and your degree/ years of experience in your field has no value.  Go for Brigham, Dana Farber, Children's, or Tufts those are the top paying hospitals with great benefits!

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator II in Boston, MA
pros:
- Great experience
- Variety of experiences
- Patient involvement
- Lots of PTO
- Over 40hrs paid overtime
cons:
- VERY low pay
- Low position on the totem pole
- VERY LIMITED growth potential
- Treated like a temporary position, not for long term career development

review_title: I enjoyed working here except pay is disappointing.
pros: Great research environment, great people. It is one of the top rated hospital in the U.S.
cons: Disappointing salary, not enough guidance for future jobs, not having enough opportunity to present your work.

pros: I worked there full time, part time and per diem for 16 years and enjoyed working there. Very accommodating when in school and later starting a family.
cons: Parking will always be an issue.

job_title: Critical Care Technician in Boston, MA
pros: Great place to get nursing’s experience.
cons: The working environment is toxic and has some racism. There too much clicks and if your not close or kissing up to the nurses it’s hard to be a nurse the floor

pros: Good team work. Great resources and benefits
cons: All depends on the floor you are on. Scheduling can be frustrating! Sometimes you won’t know until one week away. Seniority basis at MGH. Pay is less than other hospitals. Politics and no management around

pros:
Runs like a small city. 
Continually wants to improve quality of care for patients. 
Every department has its own culture. Integration and multidisciplinary management is encouraged.
cons:
Runs like a small city.
Every department has its own culture.

pros: Hires talented people, good benefits. My experience was overall positive until my direct supervisors changed.
cons: Low salary, very small raises per year, minimal chances for advancement and they are based on your department.

pros: Supportive colleagues, positive community, dedicated management, good perks, world-renowned hospital, solid health benefits
cons: Low salaries, slow bureaucracy, archaic IT systems

job_title: Research Technician I in Boston, MA
pros: The hospital provides incredibly rewarding work and the opportunity to learn from esteemed researchers in an variety of fields.
cons: It is a stepping stone position, so you can't expect good pay or levels of freedom in research topics.

pros: Best reasons to work here: resources, a lot of learning, a lot of room for advancement, continuing education, team work, food, in the city, a lot of networking
cons: parking, pay, some drama in some departments

pros: Weekly pay and amazing ataff
cons: Travel time. I would have to take a 30 min drive to the closets train station then get onto the train for 10 stops. Moving into the city was not an option at that time.

pros: Working with the brightest and most motivated nurses and physicians at a hospital that has all of the tools to succeed. It's also a Magnet Hospital.
cons: I have nothing negative to say.

job_title: Disponent / Mitarbeiter Vertrieb in Boston, MA
pros:
Top notch scientific institution
Top Hospital in USA
cons: Junior faculty are not always supported. It depends a lot on which Department/Unit you are affiliated to.

review_title: Best work experience ever.  Highly recommend.
pros: Very Good work environment ample of opportunities to learn and grow as a professional.
cons: None whatsoever, just that you get over worked sometimes.

pros:
Flexible hours.
Nice people.
Good location.
Good compensation.
cons:
Not a lot of collaboration.
Congested office.
Little feedback.

pros: Professional people and resources (i.e., state-of-art instrumentation), good benefit (i.e., medical insurance and pension), and many opportunities to learn in research and clinic
cons: Commute is hard due to traffic, and working space in the research side are too limited

pros: Opportunity to work with some of the brightest minds in the country, great benefits.
cons: Difficult promotion system for non-physicians.

review_title: Good Place to work, culture shifting
pros: work life balance, wonderful diverse community, great programs to take advantage of
cons: management tolerates unacceptable work performance and does not reward hard work, pay is not great

pros: Most people are happy and everyone is easy to get along with.
cons: My department promotions aren't based on work its based on favoritism, and how you talk and treat your supervisor.

review_title: The Massachusetts General Hospital provides exceptional care to all patients.
pros: They are fully equipped and has one of the best medical care in Massachusetts.
cons: Traffic on the area isn’t that great

job_title: Residency Program Coordinator in Boston, MA
pros: Amazing team of people. You get to work with the top physicians in the country, and the support staff is amazing.
cons: Pay is relatively lower to other companies, since MGH is non-profit.

review_title: Good people, many opportunities, growth and advancing
pros: Great experiences, many great personnel and good opportunities for taking your career in different directions
cons: Below average pay for a hospital considered to be  #1 in the state, overworked and not enough staff

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Boston, MA
pros: Prestige of the institution is unmatched. Depending on department and close coworkers can be a wonderful and supportive place to start a career.
cons: Vacation and sick days are pooled into "earned time" that also gets used for "paid holidays"

pros: Some of the best minds in the world together with a strong reputation and a large research budget = lots of opportunities
cons: The cost of living in Boston

review_title: Best hospital with cutting edge research
pros: Ideally located beside the Metro station, fantastic labs with modern equipment...
cons: Very expensive parking. It can cost upto $400. A better option would be to park it at the commuter rail station...

review_title: Great Company, each lab is a complete different atmosphere.
pros: Well known hospital, good benefits.
cons: Unfortunately, each laboratory can be a completely different jungle. Therefore it is hard to review MGH in general as they do not directly manage you.

review_title: Good experience but high turnover due to low pay
pros: Great training opportunities, a lot of learning built into the position
cons: Positions tend to be for people who need the experience before going to graduate school, not many options for promotions.

pros: The fact that you can put MGH on your resume always looks great .. Friendly environment
cons: No opportunity for growth and  2% pay raise every year .. underpaid and overworked

review_title: High turnover, burnout, culture of divisiveness, gossip, and favoritism
pros: Near revere beach, near T
cons: Culture of exclusivity and favrotism. Rules apply to the few and lots of gossip from top down. Zero support or transparency.  High patient need and acuity and burn out pervasive.

pros: Great people and great place to work. Offer continuous training in order to accommodate the fast paced changes that affect the healthcare system.
cons: I do not have any cons to offer at this time.

pros: Awesome community, pride in workplace
cons: Salary, long hours, long commute

job_title: Patient Care Associate in Boston, MA
pros: Broader scope of practice than many Boston hospitals. PCAs are responsible for phlebotomy and are very autonomous in patient care (depending on floor.)
cons: No real benefits for part-time workers. Limited opportunities for growth in role.

review_title: I was working for MGH Chelsea, MA for 2 years.
pros:
Hardworking, passionate coworkers who are there to support you
- Recognition for hard work
- Company performance has been incredible
- Working here is actually fun
cons: Long hours/ pay was not good

review_title: excellent work place... good benefits, ET here is awesome. depending on your Trade lots of OT available
pros: OT available for certain trades only.
cons: growing process can be slow

pros: This is an awesome work environment, and you have the opportunity to always learn through weekly Why N Hows, and working on projects with PIs
cons: Commuting into the city can sometimes be cumbersome.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Boston, MA
pros: Great benefits and the colleagues
cons: Management in the department have been out of touch and feel like they don't account for the workers. It's known to students in the area that working at MGH isn't great

job_title: Staff Assistant III in Boston, MA
pros: Friendly people, cutting edge research, top scientific and clinical minds
cons: Some senior administration gets away with very little work and high pay.

review_title: Lots of opportunities, come in prepared!
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow in Boston, MA
pros: everything is at hand to conduct top level research
cons: Not a good place if you are married and have a family. Good for single ambitious people to work hard day and night..

review_title: Good place to work for entry level candidates
job_title: Senior Clinical Research Coordinator in Boston, MA
pros: Good benefits. Lots of courses and other resources available to employees.
cons: Low pay in comparison to other area hospitals. Maximum 3% salary raise per year.

pros: They are a super company to work for. Despite how large of a corporation they are, they really know how to cater to their employees.
cons: I really enjoyed working here and have no complaints.

pros: Lots of flexibility, so you are able to go to school and work if you would like to.
cons: There is a bit of unorganization in terms of schdeduling. Pay rate should be a little higher.

pros: Beautiful building in a wonderful location.
cons: Corporate runs the show, from a desk, far away. Pure insanity.

review_title: Great Reputation; Opportunities if you Avail
pros: -Strong reputation; opportunity to learn/grow from colleagues;stable employment
cons: -mgmt not always well-trained; physicians' attitudes toward non-physicians

review_title: Wonderful place to work - so much learning on the job.
job_title: Clinical Research Assistant in Boston, MA
pros: Wonderful mentors and coworkers, many options in terms of employee training and "perks"!
cons: Working at a satellite site away from main campus felt isolating.

review_title: One of the best hospitals to work for
pros: Well managed. Efficient. Highly skilled and collaborative environment.
cons: Low pay. Very competitive and at times highly stressful.

pros: Extremely patient focused organization. The people are incredible and very innovative.
cons: Much of what happens in health care and at MGH occurs in silos; better collaboration and communication in all aspects would be useful.

job_title: Patient Services Coordinator III in Boston, MA
pros: MGH Perks (discounts, fun outing, employee opportunities), community, networking and growth opportunites
cons: Lots of changes, high turnaround for lower administrative positions

pros: Health benefit, health connections many locations
cons: No promotion within, no real opportunity for growth, no  raises

review_title: A wonderful and supportive place to work, with a strong sense of community.
pros: Reputation, sense of community, innovative, collaborative
cons: Can get lost in the crowd of 23,000 employees

pros:
has very strong research sources
good benefit
cons: for entry level position is a very good choice. But for senior researcher, I think the pay is a little bit lower.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator II in Boston, MA
pros: Good patient care, clean, doctors were well behaved, good Research hospital, good teaching hospital
cons: Was unpaid, no benefit, no health insurance, did not keep promise, Self centered & politics

pros: Work with amazing, smart, like-minded individuals
cons: Difficult to increase salary, benefits are OK but 403b is not matched (however 5% of salary is put into 403b account at the end of the year)

pros: Nice place to work if you work with the right group of people
cons: I do not like that the vacation days, sick days, personal days and holidays all come out of 1 pool.

job_title: Urology Technician and Medical Assistant in Boston, MA
pros: Wonderful place to work at. Has excellent benefits, good co workers, and a great location
cons: wish the benefits for the MBTA pass will discount more =/ commuting from the train is hard

pros: they have excellent benefits, 401k and retirement options. work/ life balance is also great.
cons: for a hospital that brings in a ton of revenue yearly, they don't pay their employee very well.

pros: Excellent HR support and competitive salary.
cons: My job was outsourced to another country.

pros:
-great environment to interact with national experts in academic fields
-good healthcare benefits
-1 month paid leave
cons: -typically more work (i.e. multiple experiments)  than time available to complete it

pros: Love working with children and young teens.
cons: At times the floor is not at busy in which you must take initiative and help a family or simply clean and organize.

pros: Professional, authentic inspiring to work and watch positivity driven nurses and doctors help patients
cons: not directly employed by MGH work under different organization affiliated with hospital therefore no benefits.

job_title: Certified Pharmacy Technician in Boston, MA
pros: The athmosphere here is amazing and every one is so nice

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Boston, MA
pros: Good place to work and learn as a first job if you have a nice PI

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Boston, MA
pros: I work in research and it has been a wonderful experience with fantastic physicians and managers.

job_title: Research Animal Specialist in Boston, MA
pros: Well known, good name, good location.

pros: Great place to work.  Very exciting atmosphere.  Management really cares about their employees.
cons: Can sometimes be stressful but there is a lot of support to get the job done.

job_title: Clinical Research Coordinator in Boston, MA
pros: Big, well-known, established, good reputation

pros: Great to work on important topics at a large and well-regarded institution.
cons: Environment is a very quiet cube farm with little positive interaction with coworkers.

review_title: Good place to start your first job
pros: Collaborative environment, nice people. You will get to learn a lot and have many opportunities to develop
cons: There are not many cons that I can remember of.

pros: MGH is the 2nd best hospital in the nation.

pros: Staffing ratios are good. We have access to all the supplies we need

review_title: Very professional and capable environment with employee relations

pros: Benefits, employees and the opportunity to learn new things.

pros: requires you to do your best but you can expect others to be doing their best as well to provide the best patient care possible

pros: Flexibility is great, you have to work with academics. I like it.

pros: Easily accessible from the T. The people are great but it's too fast paced for me.
